description: dancing four-armed Nataraja at center standing on a demon with fangs and a moustache; central figure flanked by Ganesha (elephant-headed figure) at left and Bhu Devi (green-skinned figure with green bird) at right; main figures appear in front of an architectural facade with a round element at center flanked by archways--all with swags and elaborate raised decorative patterning; pair of winged figures in top corners; eight figures on each side of a small bull at bottom with small shrines in each lower corner; all figures dressed in gold, with gold architectural elements; received framed and glazed with glass
dimension:
29 1/4 × 23 1/4 in. (74.3 × 59.06 cm) (sight)
31 3/4 × 25 13/16 × 2 1/4 in. (80.65 × 65.56 × 5.72 cm) (outer frame, including bracing bars on back of panel)
medium: Pigment, gesso and gold on cloth laid down on board
title: Shiva Nataraja Enshrined
